thread.title: Presidents Cup 2015: Pairings for final day singles matches
thread.title_full: Presidents Cup 2015: Pairings for final day singles matches

author: Keith Sargeant | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Presidents Cup 2015: Pairings for final day singles matches
text:
Wasn't this supposed to be a walk in the park for the Americans? 
Well, it could, in fact, end up being a good walk spoiled. 
The Internationals trail the U.S. by just one point, 9½-8½, heading into Sunday's singles action at Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea (that's Saturday night in the United States) in Incheon City, South Korea. 
MORE: How to watch final matches on TV, livestream 
The Americans, who had the far deeper roster, historically have dominated this event. They are 8-1-1 and have won the last five matches by at least three point, but this marks the smallest lead they've had before teeing off on the final day since the two teams were tied in 2005. 
"This is what we all came here for, for it to be exciting [on the final day]," International captain Nick Price said. "And, obviously, doing the singles, the setup for the singles is very difficult. But I'm going to go and ask my team to go and play golf tomorrow. Each and every one of them has to play golf tomorrow and play to the very best of their ability. That's all we can do. But I think it's been a phenomenally exciting week and I think tomorrow is going to be no different." 
Here's a look at the pairing and tee times (Eastern): 
8:15 p.m. — Patrick Reed, United States, vs. Louis Oosthuizen, International. 
8:27 p.m. — Rickie Fowler, United States, vs. Adam Scott, International. 
8:39 p.m. — Dustin Johnson, United States, vs. Danny Lee, International. 
8:51 p.m. — J.B. Holmes, United States, vs. Hideki Matsuyama, International. 
9:03 p.m. — Bubba Watson, United States, vs. Thongchai Jaidee, International. 
9:15 p.m. — Jimmy Walker, United States, vs. Steven Bowditch, International. 
9:27 p.m. — Phil Mickelson, United States, vs. Charl Schwartzel, International. 
9:39 p.m. — Chris Kirk, United States, vs. Anirban Lahiri, International. 
9:51 p.m. — Jordan Spieth, United States, vs. Marc Leishman, International. 
10:03 p.m . — Zach Johnson, United States, vs. Jason Day, International. 
10:15 p.m. — Matt Kuchar, United States, vs. Branden Grace, International. 
10:27 p.m. — Bill Haas, United States, vs. Sang-moon Bae, International.
